* @return If the attempt could not even ""leave the gate"" for some resaon, a valid {@link ConnectionFailEvent} is returned telling you why. Otherwisethis method will still return a non-null instance but {@link ConnectionFailEvent#isNull()} will be true.

NOTE: your {@link ConnectionFailListener} will still be called even if this method early-outs.

TIP: You can use the return value as an optimization. Many apps will call this method (or its overloads) and throw up a spinner until receiving a callback to {@link ConnectionFailListener}. However if {@link ConnectionFailEvent#isNull()} for the return value is false, meaningthe connection attempt couldn't even start for some reason, then you don't have to throw up the spinner in the first place.
